importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication marks the conclusion of the National League Championship Series, with the Los Angeles Dodgers sweeping the Milwaukee Brewers in four games, leading to their advancement to the World Series.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The postseason culminates on this date, with the Dodgers' sweep of the Brewers and the announcement of their entry into the World Series.

keyTakeAways: Shohei Ohtani delivered an unprecedented performance in the National League Championship Series, hitting three home runs and striking out 10 batters while pitching in a shutout for six innings.
Ohtani became the first starting pitcher since 1900 to hit a leadoff home run in the playoffs and the first since 1900 to hit multiple home runs in a postseason game.
He also became the first player in MLB history to hit three home runs and strike out at least one batter, with 10 strikeouts in a single game.
The performance occurred despite Ohtani pitching just 13 days after his last start, a rare feat given the typical five-day schedule for starting pitchers.
Ohtani was named the National League Championship Series Most Valuable Player (MVP) for his extraordinary contribution.
The Dodgers swept the Milwaukee Brewers in four games, marking their 26th World Series appearance in history and the fifth time in the last nine seasons they have won the NL pennant.
The Dodgers have lost only one game in the postseason and have not allowed more than one run per game since a prior divisional series loss.
The team’s starting rotation, led by Ohtani, includes Blake Snell, Yoshinobu Yamamoto, Tyler Glasnow, and other top-tier performers.

The Dodgers are the first team since the 2000s to return to the World Series the year after winning it, and they are the first since the Yankees’ 1998–2000 dynasty to repeat as World Series champions.
The performance is widely regarded as a historic moment, referred to as 'The Shohei Ohtani Game,' and has inspired widespread admiration from teammates and fans alike.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Japanese-American professional baseball player and two-way star (pitcher and hitter)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic and unprecedented performance in the NLCS, hitting three home runs, striking out 10 batters, and pitching a six-inning shutout, leading the Dodgers to a sweep and earning NLCS MVP honors.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers won the National League Championship Series by sweeping the Milwaukee Brewers, advancing to the World Series and cementing their place in MLB history as one of the most dominant teams in recent postseason history.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional Major League Baseball team based in Milwaukee
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the National League Championship Series, marking their elimination from postseason contention in 2025.

namedEntities.name: Freddie Freeman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Dodger first baseman and MLB player
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Freeman praised Ohtani’s performance, calling it 'incredible' and noting the historic impact of the game on fans and teammates.

namedEntities.name: Clayton Kershaw
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Veteran Dodger pitcher and future Hall of Famer
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kershaw praised Ohtani’s unique and otherworldly ability, emphasizing how playing with him elevates the team’s performance.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional Major League Baseball team based in Seattle
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners are mentioned as the opposing team in the American League Championship Series, which will determine the World Series opponent for the Dodgers.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional Major League Baseball team based in Toronto
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the opposition to the Seattle Mariners in the American League Championship Series, which will determine the final World Series matchup.

namedEntities.name: Dave Roberts
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Manager of the Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Roberts described the team’s success as a deliberate effort to 'ruin baseball,' reflecting the team’s dominance and their historic run in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Sarah Langs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Langs confirmed Ohtani’s historic milestone of becoming the first player to hit three home runs and strike out at least 10 batters in a single game.

namedEntities.name: TNT Sports
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: TNT Sports broadcast the game and reported on Ohtani’s historic achievements as a starting pitcher hitting multiple home runs in a postseason game.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Shohei Ohtani delivered a legendary performance in the National League Championship Series, leading the Los Angeles Dodgers to a four-game sweep of the Milwaukee Brewers and securing their place in the World Series. Ohtani achieved a historic feat by hitting three home runs—including one as a starting pitcher—and striking out 10 batters, becoming the first player since 1900 to hit multiple home runs in a postseason game as a starter and the first to hit three home runs and strike out 10 in a single game. The performance, occurring after only 13 days of rest from his last start, underscores his extraordinary physical and mental capabilities. Ohtani was named NLCS MVP, and the Dodgers’ dominant postseason run—only their fifth in nine seasons and 26th in franchise history—has raised expectations for a repeat of their World Series title. The team now awaits the American League champion, who will face them in the Fall Classic, with the Dodgers poised to become the first team since the 2000 Yankees to repeat as champions.
title: Shohei Ohtani’s Legendary Night Leads Los Angeles Dodgers to Another World Series, Sweeping Milwaukee in 4 Games
